Provide a lesson plan on Introduction to Addition and Subtraction suitable for students with Dyslexia and ADHD, for Kindergarten through Grade 2.

content.subject: Math - Addition and Subtraction

modified_lesson_content.title: Introduction to Addition and Subtraction
modified_lesson_content.overview: This activity introduces addition and subtraction. The teacher guides students in using manipulatives to understand the concepts.
objectives: Understand addition as putting together and adding to
Understand subtraction as taking apart and taking from

activities.description: Use counters to model addition and subtraction problems.

modifications.dyslexia: Use visual aids and large, clear fonts. Provide printed handouts of problems.
modifications.ADHD: Keep sessions short with frequent breaks. Allow movement during activities.

activities.description: Create number sentences with number cards.

modifications.dyslexia: Use color coding and symbols to aid comprehension.
modifications.ADHD: Incorporate movement, such as allowing students to stand or move while working.

modified_lesson_content.closure: Review key concepts and have students demonstrate their understanding using manipulatives.

dyslexia: Use visual aids and large, clear fonts.
Provide printed handouts of problems.
Allow extra time for activities.
ADHD: Keep sessions short with frequent breaks.
Maintain a structured environment with predictable routines.

references: International Dyslexia Association. (n.d.). Dyslexia Basics. Retrieved from https://dyslexiaida.org/dyslexia-basics/
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. (2020). ADHD in the Classroom. Retrieved from https://www.cdc.gov/ncbddd/adhd/school-success.html
National Institute of Mental Health. (n.d.). Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder. Retrieved from https://www.nimh.nih.gov/health/topics/attention-deficit-hyperactivity-disorder-adhd/index.shtml

content.subject: Science - The Water Cycle

modified_lesson_content.title: The Water Cycle
modified_lesson_content.overview: This lesson introduces the water cycle. Students will learn about evaporation, condensation, and precipitation through interactive activities.
objectives: Identify the stages of the water cycle
Understand the processes of evaporation, condensation, and precipitation

activities.description: Introduce the water cycle with a visual diagram.

modifications.dyslexia: Use large, clear fonts and visual aids. Provide printed handouts of diagrams.
modifications.dyscalculia: Use step-by-step explanations and allow extra time for activities.

activities.description: Create a model of the water cycle using interactive materials.

modifications.dyslexia: Label parts of the model clearly with large print.
modifications.dyscalculia: Use hands-on activities to reinforce concepts.

modified_lesson_content.closure: Review the stages of the water cycle and have students explain each stage using their models.

dyslexia: Use large, clear fonts and visual aids.
Provide printed handouts of diagrams.
Allow extra time for activities.
dyscalculia: Use hands-on activities to reinforce concepts.

Identify the five oceans

activities.description: Use a large world map to introduce the continents and oceans.

modifications.dyslexia: Use visual aids and large, clear fonts.
modifications.dysgraphia: Provide printed labels for students to place on the map.

modifications.dysgraphia: Allow oral responses instead of written.

modified_lesson_content.closure: Review the continents and oceans with a map quiz game.

Provide printed labels for students to place on the map.
